alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 8:01PM PST until January 30 at 12:19PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County. .Flooding continues on the Nooksack River due to Sunday morning`s heavy rainfall. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at Ferndale. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, the river will flood additional areas within the City of Ferndale including low-lying residential areas and roads including Washington Street, Portal Way and Second Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM PST Sunday the stage was 16.8 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 20.0 feet Monday afternoon. It is then expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.0 feet on 12/18/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 415 AM PST.
